title: Fairly heavy rainfall above 75 mm expected in parts of the island today
byline: The prevailing showery conditions are expected to continue over the Northern and Eastern parts of the island due to the influence of the Easterly wave, the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: PM Harini appreciates timely assistance by China for disaster response efforts
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya has expressed her appreciation for the timely assistance extended by the Government of China during Sri Lanka’s recent disaster response efforts.

title: Level 3 landslide warnings issued to residents of seven DS areas in Kandy and Nuwara Eliya
byline: Level 3 ‘Red’ landslide warnings have been issued to residents of seven Divisional Secretariat areas in the Kandy and Nuwara Eliya districts.

title: Heavy rains worsen conditions for displaced Gazans, UN warns
byline: Heavy rains over the past week have compounded the already dire living conditions of the hundreds of thousands of displaced Palestinians in the Gaza Strip, UN agencies say.

title: The Oscars to leave ABC and stream on YouTube starting in 2029
byline: The Academy Awards will begin streaming exclusively on YouTube in 2029, the latest big change in Hollywood.

title: Two former Members of Parliament pass away
byline: Former Anuradhapura District Member of Parliament Janak Mahendra Adikari and former Deputy Minister of Rehabilitation and Prison Reforms, S. C. Muthukumarana, have reportedly passed away.

title: Supplementary sum of Rs. 500B to be presented to Parliament today
byline: A supplementary estimate of Rs. 500 billion is to be presented to Parliament today (18) to restore the livelihoods of those affected by the sudden disaster situation.

title: Three suspects arrested in connection with torturing and setting fire to wild elephant in Mihinthale
byline: A total of three individuals have been arrested in connection with the alleged torture and setting fire to a wild elephant in Seeppukulam, Mihinthale, police said.

title: Putin says Russia will take more land in Ukraine if Europe sinks peace moves
byline: President Vladimir Putin said on Wednesday Russia would take more land in Ukraine by force if Kyiv and European politicians whom he cast as “young pigs” did not engage over U.S. proposals for a peace settlement.

title: Kuliyapitiya Crimes OIC transferred after assault video goes viral on social media
byline: The Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of the Crimes Division of the Kuliyapitiya Police Station has been transferred in relation to an allegation of assaulting    a person.

title: Case against Namal Rajapaksa over ‘Krrish’ deal to be recalled in February
byline: The Colombo High Court today (18) ordered that the case filed against Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa in connection with the controversial ‘Krrish’ project deal be recalled on February 16, 2026.

title: Multiple reservoirs at full capacity; Downstream residents urged to stay alert
byline: The Mahaweli Authority has announced that the Victoria, Randenigala, and Rantembe reservoirs have reached spill levels due to the prevailing heavy rainfall.

title: Julie Chung praises Starlink, Microsoft, and MIT for disaster relief efforts in Sri Lanka
byline: US Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Julie Chung, highlighted the support of American companies and institutions for Sri Lanka’s recovery efforts following Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Over 93,000 tourists visit Sri Lanka in first two weeks of December
byline: The Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) has reported that over 93,000 tourists have arrived in the country during the first two weeks of December 2025.

title: NBRO warns public to avoid unstable areas following heavy rainfall in Udadumbara
byline: The National Building Research Organization (NBRO) has reported that the Udadumbara area in the Kandy District has received over 200 mm of rainfall, raising serious concerns over landslide risks in the region.

title: Ex-podcaster Dan Bongino stepping down as FBI deputy director
byline: Dan Bongino has said he will leave his role as the FBI’s deputy director in January.

title: Port workers among 5 arrested with illegally imported cigarettes worth Rs. 330 mln
byline: The Excise Department’s Special Investigation Unit has seized a total of 2,030,000 sticks of illegally imported cigarette, estimated to be worth around Rs. 330 million, in the Wellampitiya area.

title: Disciplinary inquiry on several police officers over negligence in probing MP Asoka Ranwala’s accident
byline: Sri Lanka Police have confirmed that several officers were found negligent in performing their duties regarding the road accident involving former Speaker and National People’s Power (NPP) Gampaha District Member of Parliament, Asoka Ranwala.

title: Speaker endorses certificate on three key Bills
byline: The Speaker of the Parliament, Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne announced to the House today that he endorsed the certificate on three Bills yesterday (17).

title: EU provides over €2.35 mln humanitarian assistance to Sri Lanka
byline: The European Union (EU) has allocated a total of Euro 2.35 million of financial assistance to Sri Lanka.

title: ADB mobilizes $40M emergency trade finance support for Sri Lanka following Cyclone Ditwah
byline: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) has launched a $40 million emergency assistance facility under its Trade and Supply Chain Finance Program (TSCFP) to support Sri Lanka’s recovery from the devastation of Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Opposition seeks probe on failure to minimise damage from Cyclone Ditwah
byline: A proposal seeking to establish a Parliamentary Select Committee to conduct a comprehensive review of the alleged lack of preparedness to minimise the damage caused by Cyclone Ditwah has been submitted to the Speaker of Parliament.

title: Peter Arnett, Pulitzer-winning war correspondent who reported from Vietnam to Baghdad, dies at 91
byline: Peter Arnett, the renowned journalist who reported from the front lines of some of the most dangerous wars of the modern era, has died at the age of 91.

title: Warner Bros favours Netflix offer over $108bn Paramount bid
byline: Warner Bros Discovery has told its shareholders to reject Paramount Skydance’s $108.4bn (£80.75bn) takeover bid.

title: Magistrate’s decision to reject plaint against Deshabandu was unlawful - Colombo HC rules
byline: The Colombo High Court has ruled that the decision of the former Colombo Chief Magistrate to reject a private complaint filed against then Senior DIG Deshabandu Tennakoon was contrary to the law.
